result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Daniels

defendant.name: Daniels, Robert J
defendant.address: 5295 Youngs Lane, P.O. Box 193, Crandon, WI 54520

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert J Daniels in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:11 PM. State - resolved - complied with victim notification requirements with no response - amend count #1 - obstruct an officer contrary to 946.41 and delete domestic abuse enhancer, remaining counts will be DRI, fine of $1,000.00 inclusive of costs. Kennedy and Daniels agree. Court has plea questionnaire. Court - goes thru questionnaire, the defendant will be pleading NC to amended count #1. Daniels and Kennedy agree. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3, amends count #1 to obstructing an officer contrary to 946.41 deleting domestic abuse enhancer. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Kennedy - follow joint recommendation - gun that was seized is to be returned. State agrees. Daniels withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - $1000.00 fine inclusive of costs - take bond posted, DNA surcharge assessed - 60 DTP/CO, return gun to defendant, right to appeal, adjourned.

Final pre-trial at 09-22-2015 09:30 am.
Jury trial at 11-04-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert J Daniels in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:56 PM. State has sent discovery and offer. Court continues bond, sets for FPT and JT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State
Final pre-trial on January 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Called at 2:30 PM. Robert Daniels appears in person and with counsel Robert Kennedy Jr. State appears by Charles Simono. Kennedy has Information - provided in Court, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 1/27/15 at 2:00 PM.
Arraignment on July 8, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Called 4:15 pm. Robert Daniels in person and with counsel Robert Kennedy Jr. State by Charles Simono. Kennedy asks for sequester of witnesses. Court so orders. State calls Sargeant Marvin 4:16 pm. Kennedy moves to strike (hearsay) overruled 4:17 pm. Record reflect identification of defendant 4:20 pm. 4:22 pm Kennedy cross. State objects (relevance) overruled 4:22 pm. State objects (relevance) sustained 4:24 pm. State objects (relevance) sustained 4:25 pm. State objects (relevance) overruled 4:25 pm. State objects (relevance) overruled 4:25 pm. State objects (relevance) overruled 4:26 pm. Court finds probable cause and binds over. State files information (mirrors complaint). Substitution filed court recieves as timely. Adj.

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Paula McGeshick. No possession of any firearms
Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:40 AM. Robert Daniels appears in person and with counsel Robert Kennedy Jr. State appears by JBC. Kennedy has complaint, waives reading, waives time limits, requests PH. Court continues bond, considers time limits waived, set for PH on 5/21/14 at 3:00 PM. Kennedy - bond - ask for reduction in bond to release some of it for attorney fees. Court will reduce bond to $1000 cash and the remaidner to be released to Mr. Kennedy's trust account.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 9:17 AM. Robert Daniels appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Daniels has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Daniels will be hiring his own attorney and wishes for some more time to retain him (Robert Kennedy Jr). Court will allow an adjournment. State - don't object but not for 60 days as requested. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 4/9/14 at 9:00 AM. State - no objection to releaseing some of the bond posted for attorney fees as defendant stated he needed time to obtain money to retain the attorney.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Paula McGeshick. No possession of any firearms
